result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan Dandre Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cases called 3:50 p.m: 15CM474, 16CF352, 17CF31 and 15CT326,  Defendant Logan Dandre Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Initial appearance in 17CF31. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed in both felony cases. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Informations filed in 17CF31 & 16CF352. Reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1 in 16CF352 and 17CF31. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld in both cases, 2 years probation. Conditions: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete psychological evaluation and any recommended treatment. Submit DNA sample. $617.10 restititution in both cases, 16CF352 costs are $518. 17CF31 costs are $528. (Jail credit: 191 days in 16CF352,  no jail credit in 17CF31. 3 days credit in 15CT326.)  Defendant plead no contest to OWI cause injury in 15CT326 (ct. 1). Court found guilty, imposed 30 days jail commencing forth with  Huber granted under jail rules. Complete AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. $1,379 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. 12 month revocation, 12 month IID.  Remaining counts in all cases read in and dismissed, as well as 15CM474. Court adjourned 4:25 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 24, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
NOH for 1/23/17 @ 10:00 to Logan Smith @ 701 Monroe Street, Portage, WI  returned marked - no such number - copy to Atty. Eagon
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 23, 2017 at 10:00 am.
